metadata.title: CVE-2023-52735 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: bpf,sockmap: Don't let sock_map_{close,destroy,unhash} call itself sock_mapproto callbacks should never call themselves by design. Protect againstbugs like [1] and break out of the recursive loop to avoid a stack overflowin favor of a resource leak. [1]https://lore.kernel.org/all/00000000000073b14905ef2e7401@google.com/

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-72-generic - 5.15.0-72.79
linux-image-5.15.0-72-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-72.79
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-72-generic - 5.15.0-72.79
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-72-generic-64k - 5.15.0-72.79
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-14-generic - 6.5.0-14.14~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-generic - 6.5.0-14.14~22.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-72.79').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2').
